## Table of Contents

**Classes**

* [`flatpak`](#flatpak): Install and configure Flatpak
* [`flatpak::config`](#flatpakconfig): Configure Flatpak
* [`flatpak::install`](#flatpakinstall): Configure repo and install Flatpak
* [`flatpak::remotes::gnome`](#flatpakremotesgnome): Helper class to include popular remote for Gnome runtimes
* [`flatpak::repo`](#flatpakrepo): Configure Flatpak repo(s)
* [`flatpak::repo::apt`](#flatpakrepoapt): Configure Flatpak apt repo
* [`flatpak::repo::yum`](#flatpakrepoyum): [NOT IMPLEMENTED] Configure Flatpak yum repo

**Resource types**

* [`flatpak`](#flatpak): Provide capabilities to install/manage Flatpak apps
* [`flatpak_remote`](#flatpak_remote): Provide capabilities to manage Flatpak remotes

## Classes

### flatpak

Install and configure Flatpak

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak
```

### flatpak::config

Configure Flatpak

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak::config
```

### flatpak::install

Configure repo and install Flatpak

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak::install
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `flatpak::install` class.

##### `package_ensure`

Data type: `String`

Ensure value of the package

##### `package_name`

Data type: `String`

Name of the package in the repo

### flatpak::remotes::gnome

Helper class to include popular remote for Gnome runtimes

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak::remotes::gnome
```

### flatpak::repo

Configure Flatpak repo(s)

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak::repo
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `flatpak::repo` class.

##### `apt`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install/configure apt repo

##### `yum`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install/configure yum repo

### flatpak::repo::apt

Configure Flatpak apt repo

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak::repo::apt
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `flatpak::repo::apt` class.

##### `dist_codename`

Data type: `String`

Distro codename to use for the repo release

##### `repo_name`

Data type: `String`

Apt repo name (used for the sources.d file name)

### flatpak::repo::yum

[NOT IMPLEMENTED] Configure Flatpak yum repo

#### Examples

##### Basic use

```puppet
include ::flatpak::repo::yum
```

## Resource types

### flatpak

Provide capabilities to install/manage Flatpak apps

#### Examples

##### Install Flatpak app

```puppet
flatpak { 'org.gnome.Platform':
  ensure => installed,
  arch   => 'x86_64',
  branch => '3.2',
  remote => 'gnome',
}
```

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `flatpak` type.

##### `ensure`

Valid values: present, installed, absent, uninstalled

Aliases: "installed"=>"present", "uninstalled"=>"absent"

The basic property that the resource should be in.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `flatpak` type.

##### `name`

Valid values: %r{\A[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]*\Z}

namevar

Name of package to install. (namevar)

##### `ref`

Valid values: %r{\A[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]+(?:/[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]*){0,2}\Z}

Reference of package to install. May be full Identifier Triple.
Incompatable with `arch` and `branch`.

##### `arch`

Valid values: aarch64, arm, i386, x86_64

Architecture of package to install. Incompatable with `ref`.

##### `branch`

Valid values: %r{\A[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]+\Z}

Branch of package to install, Incompatable with `ref`.

##### `remote`

Valid values: %r{\A[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]*\Z}

Name of the remote repo to install from.

### flatpak_remote

Provide capabilities to manage Flatpak remotes

#### Examples

##### Add Flatpak remote

```puppet
flatpak_remote { 'gnome':
  ensure => present,
  url    => 'https://sdk.gnome.org/repo/',
}
```

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `flatpak_remote` type.

##### `ensure`

Valid values: present, absent

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: present

##### `url`

Valid values: %r{\Ahttps?://.*\Z}

Location of the remote repo

##### `gpg_verify`

Valid values: `true`, `false`

Verify GPG signatures

Default value: true

##### `gpg_verify_summary`

Valid values: `true`, `false`

Verify summary GPG signatures

Default value: true

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `flatpak_remote` type.

##### `name`

Valid values: %r{\A[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]*\Z}

namevar

Name of the remote
